Top-3 Similar Questions: au_1060147: How can I adjust the screen brightness in i3wm on Ubuntu 16.04?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_1060147: bindsym XF86MonBrightnessUp exec xbacklight -inc 10
bindsym XF86MonBrightnessDown exec xbacklight -dec 10

Explanations about Options.-dec: Decreases brightness by the specified amount.
Explanations about Options.-inc: Increases brightness by the specified amount.

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_17859: How can I simply adjust monitor color temperture in X?

Explanations about Options.-l:
PROVIDER[:OPTIONS]
 Select provider for automatic location updates (Use "-l list" to see available
 providers).
Explanations about Options.-m:
METHOD[:OPTIONS]
 Method to use to set color temperature (Use "-m list" to see available methods).
Explanations about Options.-t:
DAY:NIGHT
 Color temperature to set at daytime/night.
Explanations about Options.-o:
One-shot mode (do not continuously adjust color temperature). Use this with the -P
 option to clear the existing gamma ramps before applying the new color temperature.

Top-3 Similar Questions: au_763642: App to adjust gamma in ubuntu 16.04
au_1259937: Garbled Screen After Adjusting Screen Resolution
au_108406: How can I have xfce automatically adjust to changing available outputs?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_763642: xrandr -q | grep " connected"

xrandr --output DVI-I-0 --gamma 0.5:0.5:0.5

xrandr --output your_value --gamma 0.5:0.5:0.5

Explanations about Options.--newmode:
New modelines can be added to the server and then associated with outputs. This
 option does the former. The mode is specified using the ModeLine syntax for
 xorg.conf: clock hdisp hsyncstart hsyncend htotal vdisp vsyncstart vsyncend vtotal
 flags. flags can be zero or more of +HSync, -HSync, +VSync, -VSync, Interlace,
 DoubleScan, CSync, +CSync, -CSync. Several tools permit to compute the usual
 modeline from a height, width, and refresh rate, for instance you can use cvt.
Explanations about Options.--auto:
For connected but disabled outputs, this will enable them using their first
 preferred mode (or, something close to 96dpi if they have no preferred mode). For
 disconnected but enabled outputs, this will disable them.
Explanations about Options.--output: Selects an output to reconfigure. Use either the name of the output or the XID.
Explanations about Options.--gamma:
Set the specified floating point values as gamma correction on the crtc currently
 attached to this output. Note that you cannot get two different values for cloned
 outputs (i.e.: which share the same crtc) and that switching an output to another
 crtc doesn't change the crtc gamma corrections at all.
Explanations about Options.--addmode:
output name
 Add a mode to the set of valid modes for an output.

Answers.MP Summary: utility to configure and test X input devices
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_22101: How to adjust TouchPad edge scroll area in Ubuntu?
Top-3 Scripts:
au_22101: #!/bin/sh

sleep 5
xinput set-int-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "Synaptics Two-Finger Pressure" 32 10
xinput set-int-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "Synaptics Two-Finger Width" 32 8
xinput set-int-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "Two-Finger Scrolling" 8 1
xinput set-int-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "Synaptics Two-Finger Scrolling" 8 1 1
xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "Synaptics Edge Scrolling" 0 0 0
